item.title: Austria Likely to Conduct Bond Auction, But Cancellation Is an Option
item.description: The Austrian Treasury is scheduled to set out the details Thursday of the government bond auction due to take place on Dec. 12 but its advanced funding progress might enable it to cancel this operation, UniCredit Research said.

item.title: German Industrial Production Unexpectedly Dips
item.description: Germany’s industrial production fell 0.4% in October, a further sign of the deteriorating environment in the key manufacturing base of Europe’s largest economy.

item.title: Congress Moves Forward on Roughly $900 Billion Defense Bill
item.description: House and Senate lawmakers agreed to scrap the most contentious pieces of the bill, such as restrictions on abortion and transgender care for service members.

item.title: Australia Shares Close 0.1% Lower After Paring Losses
item.description: Australia’s S&P/ASX 200 closed 0.1% lower at 7173.3, pausing following its best day since November 2022.

item.title: USD/SGD Edges Higher Amid Risk-Off Sentiment
item.description: USD/SGD edged up in the afternoon Asian session amid risk-off sentiment spurred by losses across most regional equity markets.

item.title: Fight for Gaza's Khan Younis Puts Israel, U.S. on Collision Course
item.description: The fight for Hamas’s most significant remaining military stronghold is critical for Israel’s war aims but could put it at odds with a U.S. push for fewer civilian casualties and a more limited conflict.

item.title: Once Unstoppable, Alibaba Is Now Faltering
item.description: Alibaba was a major driver of China’s growing consumer economy. Now it has lost its lead—even in online shopping.

item.title: Died: Norman Lear, TV producer who mined social issues for comedy, 101.
item.description: Died: Norman Lear, TV producer who mined social issues for comedy, 101.

item.title: The IRS is rejecting more than 20,000 requests for pandemic-era tax refunds from employers that either didn't exist or didn't have employees during the required period.
item.description: The IRS is rejecting more than 20,000 requests for pandemic-era tax refunds from employers that either didn’t exist or didn’t have employees during the required period.

item.title: A group of 10 Wisconsin Republicans who tried to reverse the outcome of the 2020 presidential election have withdrawn the paperwork they sent to Congress and acknowledged that Biden won.
item.description: A group of 10 Wisconsin Republicans who tried to reverse the outcome of the 2020 presidential election have withdrawn the paperwork they sent to Congress and acknowledged that Biden won.

item.title: A ban on noncompete agreements could soon be coming to New York, potentially with a carve-out for higher earners.
item.description: A ban on noncompete agreements could soon be coming to New York, potentially with a carve-out for higher earners.

item.title: A suspect is dead after three people were killed in a shooting at University of Nevada, Las Vegas.
item.description: A suspect is dead after three people were killed in a shooting at University of Nevada, Las Vegas.

item.title: British American Tobacco is booking a $31.5 billion charge to slash the value of its U.S. cigarette business, one of the biggest corporate write-offs in recent history.
item.description: British American Tobacco is booking a $31.5 billion charge to slash the value of its U.S. cigarette business, one of the biggest corporate write-offs in recent history.

item.title: A rally in Treasurys dragged yields on 10-year notes to 4.121%, the lowest level since August, while stocks fell with the Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq declining 0.2%, 0.4% and 0.6%, respectively.
item.description: A rally in Treasurys dragged yields on 10-year notes to 4.121%, the lowest level since August, while stocks fell with the Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq declining 0.2%, 0.4% and 0.6%, respectively.

item.title: Israel said it has killed about half of Hamas's midlevel commanders in Gaza and is pressing on the suspected hiding place of the group's leader.
item.description: Israel said it has killed about half of Hamas’s midlevel commanders in Gaza and is pressing on the suspected hiding place of the group’s leader.

item.title: McKinsey's new class of partners is roughly a third smaller than usual, according to people familiar with the matter, in the latest sign that economic conditions have dented demand for high-price consultants.
item.description: McKinsey’s new class of partners is roughly a third smaller than usual, according to people familiar with the matter, in the latest sign that economic conditions have dented demand for high-price consultants.

item.title: Facebook and Instagram recommend sexual content to underage users and promote minors' accounts to apparent child predators, the state of New Mexico alleged in a lawsuit against parent company Meta and its CEO.
item.description: Facebook and Instagram recommend sexual content to underage users and promote minors’ accounts to apparent child predators, the state of New Mexico alleged in a lawsuit against parent company Meta and its CEO.

item.title: Former House Speaker McCarthy said he won't run for re-election and would exit Congress at the end of the year.
item.description: Former House Speaker McCarthy said he won’t run for re-election and would exit Congress at the end of the year.

item.title: U.S. prosecutors accused four Russian military personnel of abducting and torturing an American in Ukraine, the first war crimes the U.S. has formally charged in connection with Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
item.description: U.S. prosecutors accused four Russian military personnel of abducting and torturing an American in Ukraine, the first war crimes the U.S. has formally charged in connection with Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: President Biden's push to pass tens of billions of dollars in new aid for Ukraine stalled in the Senate, but the setback could inject new urgency into bipartisan talks over border-security measures that Republicans have demanded as a condition for their support.
item.description: President Biden’s push to pass tens of billions of dollars in new aid for Ukraine stalled in the Senate, but the setback could inject new urgency into bipartisan talks over border-security measures that Republicans have demanded as a condition for their support.
